p: Starch-based films generally have a hydrophilic character, which causes undesirable changes to their mechanical and barrier properties [ 13]. According to Atarés and Chiralt [ 14], the addition of essential oils can contribute to reducing the hydrophilicity of films and promote the development of active biodegradable packaging with antimicrobial properties. According to Leandro et al. [ 15], the bioactivity of copaiba oil can be confirmed mainly by the presence of sesquiterpenes, with emphasis on β-caryophyllene. In addition, this oil is considered a natural food additive that can be consumed pure or with food, according to the Food and Drug Administration [ 16].
